com.jme3.bullet.collision

Class PhysicsCollisionObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jme3.bullet.collision.PhysicsCollisionObject
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Savable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PhysicsCharacter, PhysicsGhostObject, PhysicsRigidBody

    public abstract class PhysicsCollisionObject
extends java.lang.Object
implements Savable
    The abstract base class for collision objects based on Bullet's btCollisionObject.

    Collision objects include PhysicsCharacter, PhysicsRigidBody, and PhysicsGhostObject.

      • objectId

        protected long objectId
        Unique identifier of the btCollisionObject. Constructors are responsible for setting this to a non-zero value. The id might change if the object gets rebuilt.

    • Method Detail

      • setCollisionShape

        public void setCollisionShape(CollisionShape collisionShape)
        Apply the specified CollisionShape to this object. Note that the object should not be in any physics space while changing shape; the object gets rebuilt on the physics side.
        Parameters:
        collisionShape - the shape to apply (not null, alias created)

      • getCollisionShape

        public CollisionShape getCollisionShape()
        Access the shape of this physics object.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing instance, which can then be applied to other physics objects (increases performance)

      • getCollisionGroup

        public int getCollisionGroup()
        Read the collision group for this physics object.
        Returns:
        the collision group (bit mask with exactly one bit set)

      • setCollisionGroup

        public void setCollisionGroup(int collisionGroup)
        Alter the collision group for this physics object.

        Groups are represented by integer bit masks with exactly 1 bit set. Pre-made variables are available in PhysicsCollisionObject. By default, physics objects are in COLLISION_GROUP_01.

        Two objects can collide only if one of them has the collisionGroup of the other in its collideWithGroups set.

        Parameters:
        collisionGroup - the collisionGroup to apply (bit mask with exactly 1 bit set)

      • addCollideWithGroup

        public void addCollideWithGroup(int collisionGroup)
        Add collision groups to the set with which this object can collide. Two objects can collide only if one of them has the collisionGroup of the other in its collideWithGroups set.
        Parameters:
        collisionGroup - groups to add (bit mask)

      • removeCollideWithGroup

        public void removeCollideWithGroup(int collisionGroup)
        Remove collision groups from the set with which this object can collide.
        Parameters:
        collisionGroup - groups to remove, ORed together (bit mask)

      • setCollideWithGroups

        public void setCollideWithGroups(int collisionGroups)
        Directly alter the collision groups with which this object can collide.
        Parameters:
        collisionGroups - desired groups, ORed together (bit mask)

      • getCollideWithGroups

        public int getCollideWithGroups()
        Read the set of collision groups with which this object can collide.
        Returns:
        bit mask

      • initUserPointer

        protected void initUserPointer()
        Initialize the user pointer and collision-group information of this object.

      • getUserObject

        public java.lang.Object getUserObject()
        Access the user object associated with this collision object.
        Returns:
        the pre-existing instance, or null if none

      • setUserObject

        public void setUserObject(java.lang.Object userObject)
        Associate a user object (such as a Spatial) with this collision object.
        Parameters:
        userObject - the object to associate with this collision object (alias created, may be null)

      • getObjectId

        public long getObjectId()
        Read the id of the btCollisionObject.
        Returns:
        the unique identifier (not zero)

      • attachCollisionShape

        protected void attachCollisionShape(long objectId,
                        long collisionShapeId)
        Attach the identified btCollisionShape to the identified btCollisionObject. Native method.
        Parameters:
        objectId - the unique identifier of the btCollisionObject (not zero)
        collisionShapeId - the unique identifier of the btCollisionShape (not zero)

      • finalize

        protected void finalize()
                 throws java.lang.Throwable
        Finalize this collision object just before it is destroyed. Should be invoked only by a subclass or by the garbage collector.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - ignored by the garbage collector
